ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: Ministry of Defence, Land Equipment, Training and Simulation Systems Programme (TSSP)

ORGANISATION.OFFICIALNAME: Ministry of Defence, Land Equipment, Training and Simulation Systems Programme (TSSP)

CA_CE_CONCESSIONAIRE_PROFILE.ADDRESS: #4325 Elm 3B NH4, MOD Abbey Wood, Filton

ORGANISATION.OFFICIALNAME: Ministry of Defence, Land Equipment, Training and Simulation Systems Programme (TSSP)

CONTACT_DATA_OTHER_BEHALF_CONTRACTING_AU.ADDRESS: #4325 Elm3C NH4, MOD Abbey Wood, Filton

TOTAL_QUANTITY_OR_SCOPE.P: The Authority has a requirement for the Management and resourcing of a Training team to deliver Tier 2+ and Tier 3 Exercises and the subsequent assessments and reporting of those exercises. The user (Director joint warfare) needs to be able to exercise, assess and report on Tier 2+ and Tier 3 commanders and headquarters staff in order to prepare them for contingent operations against defence readiness requirements. The Authority therefore requires industry to provide the management and resourcing of a training team to design, develop and deliver; the exercises, subsequent assessments and reporting. The exercises potentially can be held worldwide, with the majority in the UK.

Please note: Certain aspects of this procurement are marked UK Eyes only. Therefore the Authority only invites industry to register an expression of interest if they either already possess the appropriate level of security clearance to handle the classification referred to above, or are capable of doing so prior to the ITN return date (January 2019).
Under User (DJW) direction, provide direct support to:
a. Planning – size, narrative, layout, simulation boundary
b. Exercising – Deploy, setup, conduct, management of resources, maintain availability
c. Assessing – Record, format, after action review
d. Reporting – Exercise report, lessons learnt and recommendations to enact.
2. Provision of modelling and simulation capability:
a. Shall be compliant with Defence modelling and simulation coherence (DMaSC) ruleset.
b. Shall be able to interoperate with UK’s Operational communication and information systems (OpCIS), to enable ‘Train as we fight’.
3. Defence exercise plan (DXP) and Contingent capability readiness and standards (CCRS) process
a. Provide appropriate data management tool to enable Defence users to access and manipulate DXP data repository, to support pan Defence decisions.
b. Provide appropriate data management tool and iteratively develop, maintain, and manage application under User direction, to support CCRS process.

a. Provide suitably qualified and experienced personnel (SQEP) to support DJW mandated and ad-hoc activity. Either through renegotiation and reallocation of resource, or as a separately funded and negotiated contract.
The deadline for submitting an expression of interest for the JCAST contract is 21.5.2018.

ADDITIONAL_INFORMATION.P: TUPE will apply to this procurement, full details will be provided at ITN stage.
The contract will be required for a period of 4 years plus 2 x1 Year Options.

Tier2+ = Component level collective training and exercise. 2+ events prepare one or more Combined/Joint Combined components for operational deployment. They may be conducted on UK/NATO or Coalition partner basis.

Tier3 = Combined/Joint Task Force level events that prepare a Combined Joint Task Force for operational deployment or a PJOB (Permanent Joint Operational Base). They may be conducted on a UK, EU, NATO or Coalition i.e. Combined Joint Expeditionary Force (CJEF) partner basis.
Read.
The purpose of this PIN is to notify industry that MOD will soon be launching this competition on Defence Contracts Online (DCO).
All companies wishing to submit a bid for this competition are invited to respond with an expression of interest to this PIN at their earliest convenience, but preferably before 21.5.2018.
In order to register an expression of interest, please email david.pewton100@mod.gov.uk with the following details:
1. A nominated single point of contact detailing:
a. Full Name
b. Contact details
c. Your Company name
d. Some background information about your company and supporting statements showing that you can meet the requirements
e. Background information on your organisation’s ability to deliver UK eyes only requirements

A message confirming receipt of your submission of interest will be issued by the Authority within 5 business days, if you do not receive this confirmation mail please contact the Authority to check the status of your request.
Registration deadline.
The deadline for submitting an expression of interest for the JCAST contract is 21.5.2018. This date will be kept under review and may be extended. Any extensions will be advertised in the DCO.
Security and eligibility.

The Contracting Authority considers that this contract may be suitable for economic operators that are small or medium enterprises (SMEs). However, any selection of tenderers will be based solely on the criteria set out for the procurement in the ITN, and the contract will be awarded on the basis of the most economically advantageous tender. Suppliers interested in working with the Ministry of Defence should register on the MOD Supplier Information Database (SID) Register, available at www.contracts.mod.uk. The MOD SID is a database of active procurement organisations. Please note: the registration and publication of a company profile on the MOD SID does not mean or imply that the supplier has in any way been vetted or approved by the MOD. Suppliers wishing to compete for advertised MOD contracts must respond to any specific call for competition by submitting a separate expression of interest in accordance with the instructions of the purchasing organisation.

The Authority reserves the right to amend any condition related to security of information to reflect any changes in national law or government policy. If any contract documents are accompanied by instructions on safeguarding classified information (e.g. a Security aspects letter), the Authority reserves the right to amend the terms of these instructions to reflect any changes in national law or government policy, whether in respect of the applicable protective marking scheme, specific protective markings given, the aspects to which an protective marking applies, or otherwise.
Future procurement.
The activities detailed in this PIN do not constitute the initiation or otherwise form part of any official procurement procedure. This will be subject to a separate Contract notice.

Failure to register a submission of interest for the JCAST contract will not preclude you from responding to any invitation to tender/negotiate or such other procurement procedure as is applicable to the programme.
Additional information:
Advertising Regime DCB:
— These contract opportunities are published in the Official Journal of the European Union (OJEU), the MoD Defence Contracts Bulletin and www.contracts.mod.uk

The deadline for submitting your expression of interest is detailed within this Notice. Please ensure that you allow yourself plenty of time when responding to this opportunity prior to the closing date and time.

MAIN_FINANCING_CONDITIONS.P: Payments will be made via CP&F.

Advertising Regime OJEU:- This contract opportunity is published in the Official Journal of the European Union (OJEU),the MoD Defence Contracts Bulletin and www.contracts.mod.uk
Suppliers must read through this set of instructions and follow the process to respond to this opportunity.
The information and/or documents for this opportunity are available on http://www.contracts.mod.uk

You must register on this site to respond, if you are already registered you will not need to register again, simply use your existing username and password. Please note there is a password reminder link on the homepage.
Suppliers must log in, go to your Response manager and add the following Access code: CJJ88458M5.
Please ensure you follow any instruction provided to you here.

The deadline for submitting your response(s) is detailed within this contract notice, you will also have visibility of the deadline date, once you have added the Access code via DCO as the opening and closing date is visible within the opportunity.
Please ensure that you allow yourself plenty of time when responding to this opportunity prior to the closing date and time, especially if you have been asked to upload documents.

If you experience any difficulties please refer to the online Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ’s) or the User Guides or contact the MOD DCO Helpdesk by emailing support@contracts.mod.uk or Telephone 0800 282 324.
